definition: to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
surname Tan
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: Such people are not eligible talked of love.
sentences.chinese: 这种人无资格谈情说爱。

sentences.english: Sally and I don''t have any romantic interest in each other.
sentences.chinese: 我和莎莉都没有谈情说爱的意思。

sentences.english: All the women here speak French, the language of love.
sentences.chinese: 这里的美女会讲世上最适合谈情说爱的语言法语。

sentences.english: Do you still remember we had amorism in the blossom ocean last March?
sentences.chinese: 你曾否记得去年三月我们在花海中谈情说爱呢？

sentences.english: Riddle is widely used when young Myanmar are dating.
sentences.chinese: 猜谜语是缅族男女青年谈情说爱的媒介。

sentences.english: Do not make love before an audience, unless you are on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 在戏院里不要谈情说爱，除非你是在舞台上表演。

sentences.english: There can be no mooning and spooning about it. I mean to marry money .
sentences.chinese: 我不会浪费时间去谈情说爱，我就是为了钱而结婚。

sentences.english: We'll leave the two young people to bill and coo together.
sentences.chinese: 我们让那两个年轻人一起去谈情说爱吧。

sentences.english: The park is a favorite spot for the students to romance their girl-friends.
sentences.chinese: 公园是学生们最喜欢与女友谈情说爱的场所。

sentences.english: There were several couples spooning at the riverside.
sentences.chinese: 河边有好几对男女在谈情说爱。

sentences.english: ROME (Reuters) - Italians generally love their mobile phones and often conduct love affairs over them.
sentences.chinese: 意大利人大都喜爱手机，还常常用它们来谈情说爱。

sentences.english: Dandelions were my way of giving them love and affection.
sentences.chinese: 蒲公英就是我跟她们谈情说爱时的定情物。

sentences.english: The park was full of lovers billing and cooing under the tress.
sentences.chinese: 公园树下尽是谈情说爱的情侣。

sentences.english: There were several courting couples in the park.
sentences.chinese: 公园里有几对谈情说爱的男女。

definition: to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
see 月下花前[yue4 xia4 hua1 qian2]
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to flirt
to confide in each other (idiom)
passionate love (idiom)
lovers' rendezvous/tryst
to court/to go steady/to be dating
to chat
appointment/engagement/date/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]/to arrange to meet
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
to carry on a clandestine love affair
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
vague/ambiguous/equivocal/dubious
affection/friendly feelings towards sb/love
